image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese, looking slightly stern as he talks.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese describes recent actions in Gaza as "completely indefensible" and says he told Israeli President Isaac Herzog directly that Israel was losing support by its own actions.

title.children: 'Completely indefensible': PM signals toughened stance on Israel-Gaza war

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Chengdu (for Laura Tingle column pls don't use)

props.synopsis: The visit was a textbook case of China trying to portray itself as the steady and calm adult in the global room.

title.children: Anthony Albanese isn't doing diplomacy with China by halves

image.altText: A man in a suit points at the camera

props.synopsis: It comes hours after The Wall Street Journal reported on a 50th birthday greeting to Jeffrey Epstein that Donald Trump allegedly sent in 2003.

title.children: Trump sues Murdoch over Epstein birthday greeting report

image.altText: John Norman in a cotton field holding a cotton plant, date unknown.

props.synopsis: In an industry brimming with rumours of dodgy operators, cotton grower John Norman was staking his claim as an honest broker. But while being publicly celebrated as a farming success story, he was secretly defrauding the taxpayer.

title.children: John Norman was once celebrated as farmer of the year. Now, he's behind bars

image.altText: JAPAN TRUMP

props.synopsis: The amount of leverage or borrowing tied to bonds at present is inching closer to what we saw prior to the global financial crisis.

title.children: Bond markets in Japan and the US are flashing red, exposing Australia's superannuation sector

image.altText: Meena Singh stands in an office and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Victoria's children's commissioner has conceded "no-one" is overseeing key decisions of her office after revelations it failed to act on red flags raised about accused child abuser Joshua Brown.

title.children: 'No-one' overseeing key decisions, concedes Victoria's children's commissioner

image.altText: A democracy sausage sits in white bread held by a paper napkin.

props.synopsis: Polling booths are officially open for the Tasmanian state election, barely a year after they closed last time. Here is everything you need to know.

title.children: Tasmania's early election has arrived. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, centre, celebrates his election win with his partner Jodie Haydon (R) and Labor senate leader Penny Wong (L).

props.synopsis: The public service briefs prepared for ministers in the returned Albanese government are heavily redacted, but still offer some interesting insights into the challenges it faces.

title.children: 'Difficult few years': What the public service just told its new ministers

image.altText: Ominous rain clouds gather over Victoria's Kangaroo Ground

props.synopsis: Despite hopeful forecasts in autumn, widespread rains have so far failed to materialise across much of southern Australia. But there is hope on the horizon.

title.children: Winter rains on horizon offer hope of drought relief across southern Australia

image.altText: David Johnston Talisman Sabre

props.synopsis: As AUKUS looms, Admiral David Johnston told the ABC his organisation needs to manage money better.

title.children: Defence must get better at managing big, expensive projects, chief says

image.altText: Skiers stand next to a sign in the snow.

props.synopsis: Visits to Aussie ski resorts dropped by nearly 30 per cent since the pandemic with the expense putting it out of reach for many. But here's some tips on how to do it without breaking the bank.

title.children: Is skiing overseas really cheaper? The Japan vs Aussie alps showdown

image.altText: An army tank firing flames.

props.synopsis: The decision to gift the tanks to Ukraine's war effort encountered "logistics challenges" in its path to fruition, but more than half of the tanks have now arrived.

title.children: Australia's Abrams tanks reach Ukraine after nine months

image.altText: Mark Latham wearing a suit and tie stands in front of an australian flag

props.synopsis: As calls grow for parliament to take action against Mark Latham, University of Sydney professor of constitutional law Anne Twomey says there are limits on what parliament could do, even if the allegations are proven.

title.children: 'People elected him': Why Latham is likely to remain in NSW parliament

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Mark Carney shake hands.

props.synopsis: When Canada and Australia experienced similar election results, the impact of the Trump effect became clearer, along with its potential to shift future alliances.

title.children: The 'Trump effect' could mean an alliance shift that excludes the US

image.altText: Two men in white windbreakers hold microphones and smile. One wears a keffiyeh around his neck.

props.synopsis: British police say they will not be taking action against Irish rap group Kneecap following an investigation into comments made by its members during a performance at Glastonbury.

title.children: UK police drop Kneecap investigation over Glastonbury set

image.altText: A fan of British and Irish Lions waves a flag whilst wearing a lions mask

props.synopsis: Twelve years of anticipation will end on Saturday night when the Wallabies and British and Irish Lions face off in the first of three Test matches. Here is what you need to know about the first Test between the Wallabies and the British and Irish Lions.

title.children: Lions vs Wallabies: How to watch, when is kick-off and who is playing?

image.altText: Tim Tszyu sits on the ring apron talking to journalists

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu tells ABC Sport he is focused "on the present" as he prepares to step back in the ring with Sebastian Fundora, who he lost his WBO super welterweight world title to last March.

title.children: Tszyu ready to 'prove to everyone exactly who I really am' in Fundora rematch

image.altText: A cross woman next to a church

props.synopsis: An electoral boundary review is hanging over the heads of the state's politicians and the redrawing can either end a career or make a once comfortably held seat a knife edge fight to retain, writes Jack McKay.

title.children: The Queensland MPs facing an uncertain future as change looms

image.altText: a man in hoodie on computer as woman walks past.

props.synopsis: South Korea's new government faces pressure from both sides: young women demanding systemic reform, and disaffected young men resentful over perceived "reverse discrimination," expressing growing resentment over issues like military service and job insecurity.

title.children: New South Korea president faces balancing act on gender equality

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: The ex-partner of a Victorian woman tells a Supreme Court trial that he is guilty of her murder, prompting cheers from her friends and family as he is led from the court.

title.children: In shock move, Lachlan Young pleads guilty to murder of Hannah McGuire

image.altText: close up of ladies hands administering a flu vaccination into persons arm with rolled up sleeve

props.synopsis: The flu season is ramping up with more cases, more hospital admissions and more patients sent to intensive care units.

title.children: Flu numbers rise while vaccine rates remain low, overwhelming hospitals

image.altText: Marc Leishman swings the golf club

props.synopsis: Marc Leishman and Adam Scott have contrasting fortunes at the British Open heading into the weekend as world number one Scottie Scheffler tops the leaderboard.

title.children: Leishman shrugs off Open frustrations as nightmare round dooms Scott

image.altText: Two dolphins leaping out of the water

props.synopsis: Inside one of the world's only city-based dolphin sanctuary, the pod population has halved since becoming protected and experts fear some of their biggest challenges are ahead.

title.children: Going beneath the surface to protect dolphins

image.altText: Stephen Colbert on set on his show pointing at his salt and pepper moustache

props.synopsis: CBS announces The Late Show with Stephen Colbert will end after the upcoming broadcast season, while a Democratic senator ponders whether political interference is at play.

title.children: Questions surround CBS decision to axe Stephen Colbert's late-night show

image.altText: A headshot of Trump with a stern expression

props.synopsis: The US president has been diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency. Here's what to know about the condition.

title.children: Donald Trump has chronic venous insufficiency. Here's what that means

image.altText: Sam Darcy is congratulated by teammates after a goal

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs continue to flounder against the AFL's best teams, as a loss to Brisbane leaves their finals hopes well and truly in the balance.

title.children: Dogs coach worried about team's commitment to defence after Lions loss

image.altText: Brian To'o of the Panthers walking on the rugby league field

props.synopsis: Penrith will be sweating on the fitness of star winger Brian To'o after the NSW State of Origin representative limped off the field during the Panthers' 30-10 win over South Sydney.

title.children: Panthers win sixth NRL match in a row but star Origin winger limps off

image.altText: Ana aerial shot of kayakers paddling in crystal blue water off a mountainous island.

props.synopsis: Limits on the number of homes on world-heritage-listed Lord Howe Island cause major staffing issues for the community's only preschool, which opened just last year but is struggling to keep its doors open.

title.children: Housing shortage in paradise could close island's only preschool

image.altText: Two middle aged men in suits

props.synopsis: The final public poll of the Tasmanian election campaign shows the state is heading for another hung parliament with a potentially larger crossbench.

title.children: Final poll released ahead of Tasmanian election predicts hung parliament

image.altText: A man wearing a blue top and jeans and a woman in a red coat entering Walpole Hall alongside a door with a 'polling place' sign

props.synopsis: Independent MP for Kooyong Monique Ryan vows to introduce a bill to parliament aimed at lowering the minimum voting age, after the UK decided to reduce its voting age from 18 to 16.

title.children: Independent MP to push for lowering of Australian voting age

image.altText: independent NSW upper house MP Mark Latham inside a car as he drives into his home  in the macarthur region

props.synopsis: Federal minster Tanya Plibersek says she is baffled as to why Mark Latham's portrait remains among other leaders of the federal Labor party.

title.children: Plibersek says she cried the day Latham became federal Labor leader

image.altText: A smiling older man leans on the wing of a small plane outside a hangar in a country area.

props.synopsis: A body believed to be that of a missing pilot has been located in the wreckage of a plane in the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

title.children: Body found in search for pilot missing in NSW alps

image.altText: A pile of bright coloured ants pile together to create a raft on water. the photo is so close you can see a reflection

props.synopsis: As fire ants continue their relentless march across south-east Queensland, a biological control expert from the United States warns "one or two selfish individuals" could destroy Australia's eradication plan.

title.children: Fears a few 'selfish individuals' could lose Australia's fire ant war
